intro: Beadlea aprica, commonly known as the golden beadlea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cactaceae, which includes various cacti and related succulent plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, rounded shape and clusters of bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Beadlea aprica is adapted to arid environments, featuring thick, fleshy stems that store water. Its unique appearance and vibrant blooms make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
